title: Bacon & Cheddar Green Bean Casserole
description: This green bean casserole with bacon and Cheddar is the perfect holiday side dish, but your family will enjoy it as part of any weeknight dinner.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Trusted Brands: Recipes and Tips Del Monte Bacon & Cheddar Green Bean Casserole 4.8 (22) 16 Reviews 4 Photos This green bean casserole with bacon and Cheddar is proof that everything's better with bacon and cheese! Make your favorite green bean casserole more delicious just by adding these two ingredients. This recipe is the perfect addition to your Thanksgiving or Christmas holiday feast, but it's also a nice comfort-food casserole that works alongside any weeknight dinner. Submitted by Del Monte Updated on September 13, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 4 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 1 3-quart casserole Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This green bean casserole with bacon is easy to make with cheap ingredients. Since it comes together in just a little more than half an hour, it's the perfect low-maintenance Thanksgiving side dish. Green Bean Casserole Ingredients All the ingredients for this casserole are super convenient — and you may already have them all on hand. Here's what you'll need: Green beans: You'll need four cans of green beans (use your favorite variety, such as French-style or farmhouse cut). Canned soup: Two cans of cream of mushroom soup add richness and savory flavor. French-fried onions: French-fried onions lend flavor and welcome crunch. Milk: Use whole, low-fat, or your favorite milk alternative. Cheese: Pre-shredded Cheddar cheese will work, but it's always best to grate your own block. Bacon: This green bean casserole calls for six strips of cooked bacon. Try baking the bacon in the oven to ensure it's extra crispy (and to cut down on mess). Pepper: The casserole is simply seasoned with black pepper. There's no need to add salt, as canned soup contains plenty. How to Make Green Bean Casserole With Bacon It's so simple to make this green bean casserole with bacon. You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect: Make the casserole: Combine the beans, soup, milk, and pepper in a bowl. Add 1 ⅓ cups French-fried onions and ½ of the Cheddar cheese. Crumble five slices of bacon and stir into the green bean mixture.Bake the casserole: Transfer to a baking dish and bake in a preheated oven until the casserole is hot and bubbly. Remove from the oven and stir.Add topping and finish: Sprinkle with the remaining cheese and onions. Crumble the remaining piece of bacon, then sprinkle the crumbles on top. Return to the oven and continue baking until the onions are golden brown. How to Store Green Bean Casserole With Bacon Store your cooled leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Use within four days. Reheat in the microwave or in the oven. Can You Freeze Green Bean Casserole With Bacon? Yes! If you plan to freeze it, it's best to cook this green bean casserole in a foil pan. Once it has cooled, wrap it in one layer of storage wrap followed by one layer of aluminum foil. Freeze for up to six months. Thaw in the fridge and reheat in the oven. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "I used fresh green beans and cooked them prior to baking," says Evi Holley. "Everyone in my family could not stop eating it!!" "Green bean casserole has been a tradition in my family for generations," according to David Jordan. "I found that if I don't want to cook bacon if I'm on a time crunch, I use Hormel bacon pieces from the bacon bits section at the grocery store." Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 4 (14.5 ounce) cans Del Monte Green Beans, any style, drained 2 (10.5 ounce) cans Campbell's Condensed Cream of Mushroom Soup 2 ⅔ cups French's French Fried Onions, divided 1 cup milk ½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese, divided 6 slices cooked bacon, divided ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine green beans, condensed soup, milk, and pepper in a large bowl. Add 1 1/3 cups French-fried onions and 1/2 of the Cheddar cheese. Crumble 5 slices of bacon; add to the green bean mixture and mix until well combined. Transfer to a 3-quart baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for until hot and bubbly, about 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and stir. Sprinkle with the remaining Cheddar and onions. Crumble remaining slice of bacon over top. Return to the oven and bake until onions are golden brown, about 5 more minutes. I Made It Print 37 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Bacon & Cheddar Green Bean Casserole 01 of 04 Photo by  Del Monte 02 of 04 Photo by  Diane 11/30/2023 Excellent green bean casserole! A step above the classic green bean casserole. I knew the bacon would give it that extra something, but wasn’t sure about the cheese. I did mix the cheese in as the recipe called for, but I did not top it with cheese. I let the bacon and cheese be a surprise when you tasted it. Next time I may add a little more bacon for more bacon flavor — this wasn’t quite enough to taste among all the other flavor — but I will do everything else the same. I may not wait for another holiday before making it again! 03 of 04 Photo by  Rebecca Hudson 11/22/2018 04 of 04 Photo by  Del Monte 06/21/2017 1 You’ll Also Love Green Bean Casserole Remix 52 Ratings Best Green Bean Casserole 1,127 Ratings Green Beans with Feta and Bacon 123 Ratings Teriyaki Beef & Bean Rice Bowls from Del Monte 1 Rating Sweet Green Bean Bundles 482 Ratings Instant Pot® Green Bean Casserole 14 Ratings Green Beans with Cheese and Bacon 37 Ratings Three-Ingredient Green Bean Casserole 12 Ratings Sweet and Sour Green Beans 86 Ratings Brown Sugar n' Bacon Green Beans 6 Ratings Southern Fried Green Beans 95 Ratings Green Bean Casserole with Frozen Green Beans 9 Ratings Bacon and Brown Sugar Green Bean Casserole 1 Rating Healthier Homemade Green Bean Casserole 5 Ratings Bacon-Garlic Green Beans 27 Ratings Green Beans 53 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
